page.title: 09INDUSTRY
page.content: Early each week 3 tons of salmon come to Strathaird Factory on the Longman Estate from fish farms and sea lochs on the west coast of Scotland.By Friday 1.5 tons of vacuum packed smoked salmon has been sent to Harrods or Selfridges.Some goes to Quantas Airlines.It will be eaten in Australia Japan or America. Thirty people work here.They smoke the salmon in oak for 8 hours.Eighteen skilled workers split and slice,wearing special protective clothing for hygiene.Salmon livers are sold to make pate.The heads and trimmings will become cat food.The price of smoked salmon in shops is Â£9.00 to Â£12.00 a pound.The bigger the fish the higher the price. The leader of the pop group Jethro Tull owns all this.He won a gold disc for"Living in the Past"in 1968.
